Compare Results Between Two Methods

compare.results.Rd

This function compares the results of two methods based on their performance metrics, such as wins, ties, or losses. It calculates the total for each method and determines which method performed better.

compare.results(method1, method2, names, type)

Arguments

method1

A data frame containing performance metrics for the first method. Must include columns for wins, ties, and losses.

method2

A data frame containing performance metrics for the second method. Must include columns for wins, ties, and losses.

names

A character vector of length 2, providing the names of the two methods being compared.

type

A character string specifying the type of comparison. Acceptable values are "wins", "ties", or "losses".

Value

A data frame with the following columns:

Method

The names of the two methods being compared.

Total

The total count of wins, ties, or losses for each method, depending on the comparison type.

Best

A character string indicating which method performed better. Values can be "Yes", "No", or "Tie".

Examples

# Example usage
method1_results <- data.frame(win = c(3, 5), tie = c(1, 0), loss = c(2, 1))
method2_results <- data.frame(win = c(4, 4), tie = c(2, 1), loss = c(1, 3))
compare.results(method1 = method1_results, method2 = method2_results, 
                names = c("Method A", "Method B"), type = "wins")
#> Error in compare.results(method1 = method1_results, method2 = method2_results,     names = c("Method A", "Method B"), type = "wins"): could not find function "compare.results"
